text: DR. PARNASSUS and PERCY are performing on a street corner modern clothes. As are all the PASSERSBY who pay them no attention. They look exhausted, like beggars...and very old.
It seemed as though the Devil, after all... had triumphed... And then... one day....
A BEAUTIFUL WOMAN (played by the same actress as Valentin but older with different coloured hair) comes into view.

From the very first moment I saw her, I was head-over-heels in love. She was beautiful, enchanting, delightful, young... But I... I was several thousand years old! How could I woo her? What could I do?
CUT TO a desolate cliff top where PERCY is struggling wit PARNASSUS, trying to prevent him from throwing himself of the cliff.
Don't be a fool! You can't die! You're immortal! You'll just end up broken, in the eternity ward, and I'll be stuck looking after you! Forever!
DR. PARNASSUS breaks free, stumbles backwards, and pitche out into space. PERCY screams.
At times like these... the devil is never far away.
DR. PARNASSUS is hanging by his coat, snagged on a branch angled out from the cliff face and held, like a fishing r by MR NICK who has a great grin on his face.

CUT TO a much younger DR. PARNASSUS and the BEAUTIFUL WOM in a row boat, picnicking, as they float down a river. Th are in love, very happy to be together. PERCY, wearing a blazer, flannels and straw boater is row or punting.
The devil granted me mortality again...and youth and great powers. I won my bride. I was in love. But at what price...

The boat bumps into a submerged log. DR. PARNASSUS tries push free. Several cigarette butts float past. Looking up DR. PARNASSUS sees a man sitting on the riverbank, fishin smoking a cigarette. It's MR NICK . There is a loud and ominous clap of thunder.
...at what price....
DR. PARNASSUS looks haggard. He closes his eyes. He sways drops the paper-weight.
Father!...
At that moment the wagon lurches to a stop and we hear frantic banging on the roof. DR PARNASSUS is glad of the excuse not to go on.
We've stopped.
What do you mean `at what price'?
(turning back to his Tarot cards) It'll wait, it'll wait. Another time. Something's happened. You'd better go and see.
Typical! You insist I listen to a story and then you don't finish it!
More banging from above.
Go and see!

VALENTINA turns and goes. PARNASSUS looks miserable but, almost relieved.    He tur over the next card. It's The Hanged Man. It depicts a body hanging from a gib surrounded by several arcane objects. PARNASSUS studies the card, trying to wring some meaning it - then lays The Hanged Man in the space between the others. He takes a swig from the bottle.

head_text.subj: EXT WAGON ON BLACK FRIARS' BRIDGE NIGHT

text: The wagon has stopped in the middle of Blackfriar's bridg It's pouring with rain. VALENTINA, wearing some sort of covering against the rain climbs out of the hatch and onto the roof of the wagon. Here she finds ANTON pointing excitedly down into the Tha
Incredible! I saw somebody d- dancing in the air.. under the b- bridge..
VALENTINA looks doubtfully at PERCY who peers morosely ou from under his sou-wester and shakes his head.
It's true! There was a sh-shadow on the water, when the lightning flashed...
Lightning flashes again. We see what ANTON and VALENTINA see. A shadow, on the wat of someone `dancing', hung by his neck with a rope attach to the underside of the bridge.
(triumphant) You see! The d-dancer!
(horrified) There's someone hanging there!
(smugly to Percy) I t-told you!
A rope! Get a rope!

head_text.subj: EXT SIDE OF BLACK FRIARS' BRIDGE MOMENTS LATE

text: ANTON is `absailing' over the side of the bridge. One end a rope is tied around his waist, the other is attached to bridge parapet. A lantern dangles from his waist. VALENTINA and PERCY watch ANTON'S perilous descent. Moments later there are two bodies hanging from the bridg the mysterious HANGING MAN'S and ANTON'S. The MAN is hanging by a noose around his neck, still jerk in his dance of death. His hands are tied behind his back ANTON can't reach the MAN.
(shouting up) I c-can't reach him.
Try again!
Swing in!
Hurry up.

ANTON shoots PERCY and VALENTINA a jaundiced look and wit VALENTINA'S help on her end of the rope begins to swing b and forth. Eventually, with a big enough swing, he manages to hook h foot around the HANGING MAN who has gone limp. Dead. With extreme difficulty and great discomfort, ANTON pulls MAN close to him, takes a knife from his pocket and cuts MAN'S rope. ANTON and the MAN are now swinging back and forth togethe ANTON'S rope which is threatening to cut ANTON in half.
Arghhh!!!!
You've done it! Brilliant!
Argggg!!!
Come on, don't hang about! We're getting soaked up here!

head_text.subj: EXT PAVEMENT ON BLACK FRIARS' BRIDGE A LITTLE LATE

text: VALENTINA, ANTON and PERCY manhandle the MAN over the par and onto the pavement. DR. PARNASSUS has just stepped out onto the top of the wa Soaked. He's drunk and is swaying.
Why are you fishing dead people out of the river? He's dead. Leave him. Let's go. Before the police turn up.

He goes, unsteadily, back inside. VALENTINA and ANTON drag the MAN under the wagon, out of rain. The MAN is dressed in an expensive Saville Row suit. His jacket pockets are full of strange weights and arcane sym have been scrawled on his forehead. He's about 30 years o and very handsome.
The MAN appears to be dead but VALENTINA decides to try t kiss of life. ANTON is made uncomfortable seeing VALENTINA administer t kiss of life and he pulls her away.
No! That won't work. And anyway, you d-don't know where he's b-been. Let me...

He brings both fists down hard on the centre of the MAN'S chest. Boing! The `dead' MAN coughs, sits bolt upright, spits ou little metal tube and smashes his head on the underside o the wagon, knocking himself out. The little metal tube clatters over the asphalt.
He's alive!
Thank God.
Well, he was.
ANTON picks up the little metal tube and examines it.
What on earth is this?

head_text.subj: EXT BLACK FRIARS' BRIDGE REAR OF WAGON MOME

text: VALENTINA, ANTON and PERCY drag the MAN from under the wa and carry him to the rear.
Put him in the big trunk.
B-but...
Don't argue.
The boss said leave him.
He thought he was dead.
They start to bundle the MAN in one of the travelling tru attached to the back of the wagon. With the body hanging half in half out, ANTON suddenly stops.
I d-don't like it. It's none of our b-business.
So, what do you suggest, we leave him on the side of the road?
ANTON doesn't want to answer that one.
(walking away) Definitely.
VALENTINA, single-handedly, hefts the MAN into the trunk carefully places a cushion under his head. An action not missed by ANTON.

The wagon stands, hidden, among deserted derelict buildin All is quiet. The lid of the big travelling trunk slowly opens. The MAN struggles out. His neck is sore, his wrists ache his head is bruised. He hasn't a clue where he is. He tri to make sense of the wagon, the grazing horses, the derel buildings. Some distance away a bizarre, horned and tailed CREATURE involved in a strange contorted dance. Hoping to avoid the CREATURE, the MAN starts to move away is stopped by a squeaky voice behind him.
Hey, you!
The MAN turns around to find PERCY looking at him.
I suppose somebody saves your life everyday of the week.
(croaking) What?
He can hardly speak. It hurts him to do so.
Too much like routine to bother with a thank you.
(with difficulty) Who are you?
Percival St. Antoine della Touraine et Sansepolcro da Piemonte the Third. If that proves too difficult, you may call me Percy.
Where are we?
Geographically, in the Northern Hemisphere. Socially, on the margins. Narratively, with some way to go. And your name is...
(appalled) I... I can't remember.
That's handy.
PERCY whistles to the dancing CREATURE, who turns and approaches. The MAN is getting very nervous.
Any credit cards?
What?..Oh..OK... you can have whatever you want.. just don't..
...with your name on them.
Ah...right.. good idea. (searching his pockets)
My wallet... it's gone. Nothing. I've been robbed.
Don't look at us.
What's your name?
(sceptical)
He can't remember. Suddenly a mobile phone starts ringing. They all look at each other. It's in the MAN'S pocket. But, he doesn't mov The CREATURE takes his head off ..it's ANTON.
Might be for you.

They'll know who you are. The MAN still doesn't move. ANTON reaches over and tries find the phone in the MAN'S pockets. The MAN tries to pus him off and find the phone himself. The phone is retrieve but, in the struggle to answer it, it's dropped. A WOMAN SPEAKING RUSSIAN can be heard from the phone. As ANTON and the MAN dive for it, the MAN `accidently' steps it. The phone is crushed.
Pity.. I speak Russian. ANTON and PERCY glare with deep suspicion at the MAN.
Dammit! I told you to leave him. He was dead. DR. PARNASSUS, holding a cold, damp towel to his throbbin head, appears, coughing and miserable from the wagon.
Well, we didn't and he isn't.
He was hanging under the b-bridge.
Hanging?
(handing Parnassus the noose)
By his neck. Until dead. If we'd had any sense. ANTON produces the bricks with strange markings that were the MAN'S pockets.

We found these in his p-pockets. DOCTOR PARNASSUS examines the bricks with great interest. He pulls out The Hanged Man card and compares it's arcane details - a noose, strangely marked shapes like bricks, a metal tube - to the objects found on the MAN.
The hanged man!
Is he okay? She appears from inside the wagon.
(to man)
Are you alright?
Yes... thank you.
(to PARNASSUS who is in deep thought)
He tried to kill himself.
With his hands t-tied behind his b- back? They all look at one another. Good point.
Actually, I saw that trick performed many years ago at....
S-somebody was trying to k-kill him.
My God... that's exciting.
We c-can't let him stay with us.
Why not?
We d-don't know what this is about, who he is, what he m-might have done...
(croaking)
I haven't done anything. I'm sure. I hope. Please... Give me the benefit of the doubt. PERCY and Anton exchange knowing looks.
(appealing to PARNASSUS)
Father? DOCTOR PARNASSUS, looking up from his study of the bricks noose, takes the MAN aside, looks closely, trying to read strange markings on his forehead.
These marks... I recognize them.
(puzzled)
Marks? The MAN wipes his hand across his forehead. Looks at his hand.. confused.
(sotto voce)
You've been sent by Mr Nick.
(puzzled)
Mr Nick?
(impassioned)
Don't toy with me. Tell me you're an emissary from Mr Nick.

Tell me you've come with a proposition. Tell me what I want to hear! TONY doesn't know what DR PARNASSUS in talking about but grasps the fact that if he wants to be allowed to stay he he needs to play along.
Yes.
Thank God! Thank God! Thank God for that! DOCTOR PARNASSUS takes PERCY aside, shows him the Hanged Tarot Card and indicates the MAN with a nod.
He's from Mr Nick.
No he's not.
He's come with a proposal.
No he hasn't.
All is not lost.
What proposal?
Father?
(looking at the card, then to the MAN)
You're welcome.
(croaking)
Thank you. PERCY groans and tears his hair. VALENTINA is pleased. ANTON is not. VALENTINA kisses PARNASSUS on the cheek.

head_text.subj: INT DOCTOR PARNASSUS' DEN A LITTLE LATER

text: The MAN precedes DOCTOR PARNASSUS in the tiny room. He lo around in amazement.
We can talk here. Sit down, sit down.
Thank you. He does so. DOCTOR PARNASSUS sits opposite him.
(expectantly)
So...
(trying to look on top of it)
I like your study.
The message.
(cautiously)
The message?
The message! What's the message? From Mr Nick. What does he want?
Ah... Well... That's the problem...
Problem? What problem?
Unfortunately... I've lost my memory.
What!?
It'll come back. I'm sure.
You've lost your memory?
I just... it needs time... to recover.
(incredulous) You've come here with a message.... A vitally important message from Mister Nick... A matter of life or death... and you can't remember what it is!?
Not at the moment. I'm sorry. It's never happened before.
AAAAARRRRRGGGGHHHH!!! BUGGERBUGGERBUGGER!!!!!

head_text.subj: EXT SHOPPING MALL PARKING LOT NIGHT

text: The wagon is parked in a shopping mall parking lot. The theatre is being opened up by PERCY and ANTON. There are few late night SHOPPERS coming and going.
VALENTINA, dressed as `Beauty', is rummaging in a theatre skip, helping the MAN find something to wear for the show There is a slight whiff of sexual attraction in the air.
He says you must work... to focus your mind. You can help out front.. sell tickets. Ah, here we are... (Pulling out a full bottomed wig) Try this. You can be `Justice'.
The MAN tries on the wig and looks in a mirror. VALENTINA tries not to laugh.
(pulling a face) Exactly. A laughing stock.
Just like the rest of us.
(pulling out a carnival mask) I think I'll hide behind this.
No face. No name. The mystery thickens. I'm going to have to give you a name...
She presses a metal breast-plate to his chest.
... until you remember who you are, I dub thee Saint George. You can save me from the dragon. George.
Hold on!.. what dragon?
You've met Parnassus.
Mischievously, she ties a chiffon tutu around his waist.
Now you are making fun of me.
VALENTINA giggles.
I'm sorry but, nobody laughs at me without paying the price....ah,ha.
He begins tickling her. She laughs uncontrollably, fallin backwards into the costume skip..
We c-can't do it. We...
ANTON enters wearing his Mercury gear.       He freezes, GEORGE and VALENTINA rollicking about.       They stop, l
Hi, Anton.... what?
The show. We c-can't do it. It's your father...
(alarmed)
What is it? What's happened?

head_text.subj: INT DOCTOR PARNASSUS' CABIN MOMENTS LATER

text: VALENTINA and ANTON arrive in the doorway, dismayed. GEORGE hovers in the background. DOCTOR PARNASSUS is attempting to get ready for the show he's so drunk he can hardly stand. He's already put some article of clothing on back-to-front or inside out. PERCY trying to help.
Oh no!
Can he remember! (seeing Man in doorway)
Can you remember?
Not yet.
Bloody useless! Mr Nick sends an emissary and he can't bloody remember! It's a bloody disaster!
You can't go on. You're drunk.
I am not drunk! I'm under considerable stress.
(to Percy
You'll have to do it.
No! No understudy! The audience won't tolerate an understudy! There's only one Doctor Parnassus, and I am he!
(interrupting) Somebody make some strong coffee.
EVERYONE looks at George.
Strong coffee? Brilliant! (sarcastically saluting George) This is why fate has brought us together. Don't worry about remembering... It's all the same to a man on a galloping horse!

head_text.subj: EXT SHOPPING MALL PARKING LOT THEATRE

text: DOCTOR PARNASSUS is on   stage, floating' on his glass pi apparently in a trance   but,humming erratically. He is f by VALENTINA and ANTON   who stay close to PARNASSUS in c falls. PERCY is in his   medieval costume/one-man-band ou They all look uneasy.

(a bit low-key) For one night only... raise your sights... encounter the majesty, the beauty, the miracle that's in each and every one of you. Take this opportunity to expand your horizons. It's not too late. Experience the Imaginarium of the great Doctor Parnassus.
VALENTINA peers out over the `footlights' in the hope of catching sight of GEORGE.
Where's George?
He's nowhere in sight.
(sarcastically) P-probably remembered he had a wife or t-two back in Russia.
VALENTINA gives him a dirty look.

head_text.subj: INT SHOPPING MALL SUPERMARKET THAT MOMENT

text: GEORGE, wearing his `romantic' Venice carnival mask is sm talking several middle-aged LADIES on queue at the supermarket check-out. He's carrying the theatre's ticket dispenser.
Three tickets for the price of two... That's a fantastic deal. It's a brilliant show. Much better than sex. Much ribald laughter from the flattered LADIES.

head_text.subj: EXT SHOPPING MALL PARKING LOT LATER

text: The shoppers have gone. The last car drives out of the ca park leaving it empty except for the theatre wagon. ANTON, VALENTINA and PERCY are on their own. PARNASSUS, on his plinth, is asleep and snoring.
Thank G-God... N-not a single customer!
Let's close up quick while the going's good.
(amazed)
He's never not done a show before... Maybe he's past it. (hopefully)
Maybe it's time to retire. PARNASSUS groans in his sleep.
(looking out front)
Oh n-no! ANTON sees GEORGE heading towards them with a mob of MIDD AGED WOMEN in tow. Bubbling with excitement, the mob arrives.
Oh look! How fascinating.
The other WOMEN agree.
(looking at her watch) When does the next show start?
There isn't a next show.
EVELYN and the other WOMEN are puzzled.
We've done all the shows we're doing here this evening.
But we've got tickets.

GEORGE looks hopefully at VALENTINA and ANTON who don't k what to say. We hear a crash. THE CAMERA PANS around. PARNASSUS has fallen off his perc and is now lying on the floor...snoring and mumbling. VALENTINA and some of the WOMEN run forward.
This man's drunk. Dead drunk.
Disgraceful.
(suddenly defensive of her father) He's not drunk. He's got a bad cold....
But being a true professional he tried to keep going, at considerable risk to his health.
VALENTINA and GEORGE exchange a quick look. VALENTINA thi she's found a kindred spirit.
We want our money back.

No problem...dear ladies. No problem at all. I'm so terribly sorry. I can't apologize enough. You can have your money back or, if you like... an extra free ticket. Better yet, two extra free tickets if you buy another ticket at half price. This offer is only available today. The WOMEN look on the verge of taking up the offer. ANTON and PERCY exchange looks. They can't believe GEORGE chutzpah.

head_text.subj: EXT CAR PARK A LITTLE LATER

text: The wagon rumbles across the deserted carpark.
A large pile of coins with quite a few notes mixed in tum onto a table. GEORGE is emptying his pockets while VALENT and ANTON look on..
Wow! You took all that?
I got carried away.
Lying through your t-teeth can do that to you.
Anton!
(unperturbed)
Most of them were coming tomorrow.
What tomorrow? We're gone.
(shrugs) Okay, if it makes you feel better, I'll give it back.
(sarcastic) N-no, keep it. Thanks to you we can afford to buy Valentina a b- birthday cake.
(offended) That's enough!
ANTON storms off. GEORGE looks at VALENTINA sympathetical
Don't be angry with him. He's a little bit jealous. He's young. Insecure. I'll make it my job to boost his confidence.
VALENTINA smiles at George with admiration and approval.
When's your birthday?

head_text.subj: EXT SUPERMARKET CAR PARK THAT MOMENT

text: As the wagon trundles out of the deserted car park a DARK FIGURE hops onto the rear platform.

head_text.subj: INT DOCTOR PARNASSUS' CABIN MOMENTS LATER

text: DOCTOR PARNASSUS is groaning and clutching his head. He h fierce hangover. He pours some powder from a packet into glass of water, stirs it with his finger and knocks it ba He grimaces and shudders. A hatch/shutter on the small window behind him slides ope reveal the grinning head of MR NICK.
You shouldn't drink, it doesn't agree with you.
Startled, DOCTOR PARNASSUS spins around.
What do you want? I'll do anything.
(smiles) I know.
You're man's lost his memory! He's bloody hopeless!
He's not my man.
What?
Tony Shepherd. Little toe-rag. He used to run a big charity. I wouldn't trust him. But then... you don't trust me do you?
For God's sake! Tell me what you want!
I just thought...seeing you so upset last night...that you needed a glimmer of hope...maybe a little bet?
On Valentina?
No?
You bastard!
First to five?... You might win. And save her. What do you have to lose?
I'll kill you!
(laughs)
Now that would be something. By her birthday then.
What! Impossible!..you've seen the business we're doing.
Things are going to pick up. As sure as eggs is eggs. He closes the hatch/shutter with a bang.
Wait! Too late. He's gone.

Back amongst the derelict buildings the Troupe is resting doing chores. The horses are grazing. VALENTINA sits at a mirror fussing with various hair styl slyly trying to catch GEORGE's attention. PARNASSUS, holding his aching head, sits a short distance away sadly watching her. PERCY is with him.
Five souls.. two days, eh!?
Shh! I'm trying to think.
I told you didn't I?
What?
That he was a wrong-un. PERCY nods his head in George's direction.
Trust in providence, Percy. Remember the hanging man. The cards don't lie.
No... but they sure as hell like being economical with the truth.
CUT TO ANTON who is painting a long-stemmed, wooden flower...he comes over to VALENTINA with it in his hand.
(looking away) Don't talk to me.
P-please...I'm sorry about last night. I behaved like an idiot.
Yes.

ANTON suddenly plops down on his arse in a puddle of mud. Then spins, flips the flower high into the air and, rolli face down onto his stomach, catches the stem with his clenched buttocks. VALENTINA bursts out laughing.
You must admit... even idiots have their qualities.
CUT TO GEORGE who is peeling potatoes, badly. PARNASSUS a PERCY come up behind him.
George... We'd like to know who you really are.
What?... Yes. Me too.
I may be able to help.
Really? What?... How...?
PERCY produces a small contraption with wires from behind back and gives it to DR PARNASSUS.
Hold this piece of wire.
You won't feel a thing. GEORGE takes the end of the wire.
I'm going to put the tips of my fingers on the top of your head. He does so.
I want you to relax and try as far as possible to think of nothing.
That's not difficult... in my condition. DOCTOR PARNASSUS closes his eyes. He seems to be making a effort.
Hold your breath. GEORGE does so.
Very good, very good. Yes... Yes, I see... I see... Very interesting. DOCTOR PARNASSUS takes his hand from GEORGE'S head and gi the contraption back to PERCY.
You may breathe normally. The effort seems to have tired PARNASSUS. He needs to sit down.
What... ?
Alas, this technique has its limitations.
But... Did you discover anything?
(dramatically)
Your name.
My name?... What is it? PAUSE.
Anthony Shepherd.
(stunned)
My God! That's it! You're right! Anthony Shepherd! They call me Tony. Tony Shepherd! That's who I am! VALENTINA and ANTON begin to pay attention and gather aro
And... you used to do good works. Something to do with charity I think.
Yes...That's right! That's right! But how?...
(dismissively)
It's an ancient technique of mental divination, but I'm very rusty and it doesn't always work satisfactorily.
But that's amazing! Brilliant! (oddly concerned)
Was there anything else? DOCTOR PARNASSUS shakes his head, no.
(relieved)
That's absolutely fantastic! Thank you. Perhaps I'll remember other things. PARNASSUS smiles and bows slightly ironically.
Charity work? I knew you were a good person.
So what was he doing dangling under a bridge from his neck?
Percy!
(sarcastic)
Oh dear, was that a rude question? Have I put my foot in it?

That's so strange. And horrible.. it's a complete blank. But I do remember I was involved in some sort of charity.. trying to do good, to make the world a better place, you know...inspire people, give them hope.... (self deprecatingly)
What an arrogant idiot. VALENTINA looks at him thinking `what a sympathetic perso The sound of a flutey whistle distracts him. ANTON is blo a tune on the metal tube he found on the bridge.
What's that?
(with a superior air)
Mozart's flute concerto in G.
I mean, the pipe. Where did you get it? ANTON looks at the metal pipe.
I found it.
It's mine.
Oh. You're a musician n-now.
It's not a musical instrument. May I have it?... Please.
(teasing)
Are you s-sure it's yours?
Positive.
Alright. ANTON appears to offer the pipe to TONY but palms it so t when TONY reaches out to take it, it's gone.
It's g-gone.
(getting shirty)
Don't fool around.
Ah, there it is. TONY once more tries to take it. Once more ANTON makes it disappear.
(angry)
Give it to me!
(derisively)
Oooooh!
Anton, that's enough. She steps forward, takes the pipe from ANTON and gives it TONY.
Thank you. DR. PARNASSUS, who's been watching this exchange, looks thoughtful.
PARNASSUS and CO are preparing to move out and do a show. ANTON is working near PARNASSUS and PERCY who are unaware his presence.
What's eating Anton? ANTON pricks up his ears.
He's in love with Valentina?
(dumbfounded)
In love....?
It happens.
The little snake! I'll skin him alive! CUT TO ANTON who winces.
While you're at it, don't forget the other one. DR. PARNASSUS looks at PERCY questioningly.
The viper, the scorpion, the amnesiac boa constrictor. Tony.
Quite another kettle of fish.
Really?
He's ambitious, energetic... a man of destiny.
(ironic) And he's going to help us win five souls.
I think he might. Valentina sees good in him.
She'd be better off with Anton.
CUT TO ANTON who's pleased.
Perhaps I should offer her hand to whoever helps most in winning the next five souls.
CUT TO ANTON who looks puzzled.
That's even worse than the other ideas you've had today.
(sighs) You're not wrong... Ah, Percy, what would I do without you?
Get a midget.
CUT TO ANTON as he moves, thoughtfully, away.
The theatre, parked outside a pub, is up and running. ANTON, as Mercury, is doing his pitch.
Sleep no more. Procrastinate no longer. Embrace this once in a life- time opportunity. Let the mind of Doctor Parnassus be the portal to the infinite world of your imagination.
Behind the curtain, PERCY is signalling VALENTINA to see DOCTOR PARNASSUS has been drinking. She sniffs him.
What are you doing? Please concentrate. We've got a tremendous amount of work to do tonight. A great deal depends on it.
A roll on the drums from PERCY. The curtain rises. DOCTOR PARNASSUS `floats' above the stage on his glass plinth.
As old as the universe itself, the great Doctor, versed in every mystic practice known to man, and many more besides, will guide you to your destiny.

However, the AUDIENCE - a few PASSERS-BY and DRINKERS who have drifted out of the pub for a smoke - aren't much interested in ANTON. Instead they pay more attention to t masked TONY who, decked out in a stylish costume, is work the sparse crowd with his smooth charm. ANTON, irritated, glances back at DOCTOR PARNASSUS who is worried about the lack of customers. TONY is now surrounded by fascinated WOMEN. They laugh at of his jokes. One pretty young woman, SALLY, in particula seems to be smitten by the handsome `actor'. TONY smiles seductively at her. The sight provokes ANTON. He leaps off the stage, grabs S by the wrist and begins to pull her to the stage. PERCY keeps playing.
(laughing) What?... Hey, what you doing?
T-taking you to the heart of your imagination!
ANTON is trying to compete with TONY but just can't manag the charm.
(good humoured) Oh my god! No way!
You won't regret it!
Go for it Sal!
(indicating friend)
Only if she comes with me.
(enthusiastic)
Now you're talking! A few ONLOOKERS cheer.
N-not at the same time! ANTON is still pulling SALLY onto the stage.
I'm not going on my own.
Your imagination is a very special place. Doctor Parnassus will make it flower.
I bet he will. More laughs.
We'll do it together. More laughs.
(shakes his head)
No. T-two c-competing imaginations in the Imaginarium at the same time... it's n-not advisable.
Eh?
The stronger imagination will overcome the weaker and then there's n-no knowing what might happen.
That's really stupid.
Let go!
D-don't be afraid, d-dear lady. You'll be safe with me. Anton sweeps her off her feet and carries her onto the st
Put me down!
Have no fear.
She doesn't want to do it on her own!
Only b-because she d-doesn't realize...
Let go of her you silly pillock! VALENTINA, worried, steps forward to try and restrain ANT
Anton...

It's alright! It's alright! Staggering under the weight of the struggling SALLY, ANTO barges into DOCTOR PARNASSUS' on his glass plinth. The plinth rocks and teeters. VALENTINA tries to stop it falling. ANTON, unaware of what he's done, disappears through the mirror as DOCTOR PARNASSUS crashes head first onto the st Crack! From behind the mirror comes the sound of a woman's terrifying, terrified screams.
SALLY! They've got her in there! That's her screaming! SAL! They doing something to her! SALLY! Help, somebody! Help! Save her! Upstage VALENTINA tends the stunned DOCTOR. He clutches h head in pain.
Father! Father!

head_text.subj: INT/EXT THE MIND OF DR. PARNASSUS THAT MOMENT

text: Terrified, ANTON and the screaming SALLY are spun through black void clinging desperately to an asteroid as planets stars spin madly around them. Blood-red lightning bolts crackle and crash. Chaos.
Out front, the CROWD, larger now, is reacting badly to th dreadful screams. Sally's friends try to storm the stage. TONY and PERCY try to hold them back.

Please. Everything's alright. It's okay. Really. I promise you. A MIDDLE AGED WOMAN hits him with her handbag. TONY and PERCY are in danger of being overwhelmed. We can still hear Sally screaming from somewhere within the stag
Ladies and gentlemen. Ladies and gentlemen....please... A DRUNK takes a swing at PERCY, misses, and connects with TONY.
Ugh! He falls off the stage and disappears into the angry CROW who begin pummelling and kicking him.

PERCY, desperate, produces a pistol and fires a couple of shots into the air. EVERYONE dives for cover. PERCY, taking advantage of the temporary lull, begins to around, untying, unhooking, and pulling on ropes. The theatre begins to close up as the horses bolt and the wagon clatters off down the street, bits falling off as i goes.
Somebody call the police!

A battered TONY, chased by the enraged crowd,just manages clamber on board, with the help of VALENTINA. The wagon narrowly succeeds in out-pacing the fastest of CROWD. As it disappears down the street, a figure is dump unceremoniously out through the back door of the wagon. It's the terrified SALLY, sent sprawling in the middle of road. A figure steps out from the shadows to help her to her fe It's MR. NICK in his bowler and red waistcoat.

A police siren howls as the wagon comes crashing around t corner of a great rubbish tip and clatters to a halt... t horses steaming, sections of the theatre hanging loose, broken..an utter mess. The siren fades into the distance.

Amongst collapsed scenery PARNASSUS lies in a heap. The others are struggling to their feet. ANTON is desperately trying to do something useful to help PARNASSUS but, VALENTINA pushes him out of the way.
What were you thinking? Look what you've done. Get out of the way! (appealing to Tony) Tony.
TONY, battered and bleeding, helps her lift PARNASSUS and manoeuvre him to his room.
ANTON is mortified.      PERCY pats him on the back.
Better luck next time.
TONY helps VALENTINA get PARNASSUS comfortable.
(babbling) This is my punishment. All is lost. First to Five. One down. Impossible, Valentina. First to five. One down. No people. No time, Valentina. We are doomed.
(very concerned) Ssshhhh... Thanks, Tony. Leave us.
TONY, nods, leaves slowly. Listening.
PERCY is angrily banging about, trying to repair the dama ANTON is trying to help but, is just getting in the way.
Do me a favour. Take a long walk off a short pier.
TONY arrives.
Can I help?
Bugger off!
TONY finds ANTON sitting despondently a short way from th wagon swigging from a bottle. He sits down next to him.
L-leave me alone.
What were you doing to that girl behind the mirror?
(incensed) What are you suggesting?
Oh, c'mon...we all heard her screaming.
I was screaming as well.   It was t- terrifying...
Terrifying? Why? I don't understand.
(reluctantly) No, well...you wouldn't. You've n- never been inside the D-Doctor's mind have you?
Your not trying to tell me that mind control stuff is real?
You think it's some k-kind of scam, d-don't you?
Isn't it?
No... But I d-don't expect you to g- get it... N-not in a million years.
Hang on.. if he can really control people's minds, why isn't he ruling the world? Why bother with this crappy side show?
He d-doesn't want to rule the world d-does he?... He wants the world to rule itself!
What a waste... Tell me about the mirror. What's the point of that, if not to razzle-dazzle the public?
(smiles sardonically)
You're way off the mark. (taking a swig)
It's a b-bloody great mystery... wrapped in a b-brown p-paper b-bag enema...or do I mean, enigma... He pulls himself up and starts to stagger off.
Er... one more thing....Does `first to five' mean anything to you? ANTON looks at TONY with loathing.
I thought you were the c-clever one. He walks away into the darkness. TONY sits there busily thinking.

The morning light suffuses mountains of domestic refuse. Rubbish for as far as the eye can see. Plastic sacks of various colours, many spilling open. A few fires are burn Flocks of scavenging sea gulls hover and dive, screaming murder. On one of the many pinnacles of garbage sits a lonely fig It's ANTON, depressed, angry, forlorn. The CAMERA SWINGS ROUND to show, below ANTON, in a valley waste material, the wagon.
PERCY has spread out the broken scenery assessing the dam In the shadow of the wagon VALENTINA is changing TONY'S dressings.
Thank God it's only cuts and bruises. I thought we'd lost you.
If you hadn't been there...
He holds her hand.    Looks deep into her eyes.
Valentina, your father seems in a terrible state. Is it the police? The show? Maybe I can help.
I don't know what's wrong with him, but if it's about the show...I don't care. I'm tired of it...let the police arrest us. I'm sick of living like this....
She looks miserable. TONY puts his arms around her.   Hol her tightly to him.
Don't say that. What you're doing is important. Really important. It's just... maybe... it should be done in a different way.
He is about to kiss her.
What sort of "different" way do you suggest?
DR. PARNASSUS, grim faced, head bandaged, steps from behi the wagon. TONY and VALENTINA quickly disengage.
Oh, hello, good morning sir. How are you feeling? That was a nasty bump on the head you got..
(beady eyed) "Different?"
Well, sir, I've been thinking... It's clear the show's not attracting many people. Forgive me but... I see two ways of tackling this problem.
Either the style of the show is at fault... or the type of audience. I would suggest changing both. PERCY has appeared, dragging a damaged flat.
Change the show!? Who the fizzing hell do you think you are?......
Shhh! He sits down heavily.

I'm sorry but.. you're not modern. People want modern. Look. He holds open a tattered fashion magazine to a page of beautifully photographed models in a fabulously magical setting. He thumbs through more pages of dreamy images.
This is modern. It works. Trust me, I understand this world. (with a wink)
This kind of mind control. Let's try to meet the public halfway.. the right public.. and in a better part of town. From behind the wagon ANTON watches forlornly.   Alone an unnoticed by the others.
What about the filth?
(puzzled)
What?
The filth. The police.
There'll be a better class of police too.
That'll be the day.

The trick is not to hide. Change your colours. Be bold. Go where they would least expect to find you. I think we have been brought together for a reason. I don't believe in coincidence. You saved my life. Now let me do something in return. PARNASSUS confers with PERCY.
Our time's nearly up... This could be what we need.
(to Valentina)
This can be my birthday gift to Valentina. VALENTINA smiles and nods to PARNASSUS.
Well then... (with a burst of energy)
For God's sake let's do it!!!
(sighs)
Yeah, okay, but what exactly do we do?

Well... First of all, I want you to give me your money. All of it. What?!   PARNASSUS, PERCY, and VALENTINA look at each oth Then PARNASSUS sees something beyond the wagon...ANTON, downcast, heading off through the swirling plastic bags a flying rubbish... a battered suitcase in his hand.
Anton!   Where are you going? No answer from ANTON. VALENTINA runs after him but, he marches on silently.
What are you doing? Didn't you do enough damage last night? (pummmelling his back)
Anton... I'm the one who wants to run away! (he slows)
Are you trying to wreck my birthday, or what? Anton stops, still not looking at VALENTINA he slowly dro his suitcase.
Please. We need you. Moved, ANTON turns to her.   She smiles sweetly.
How much money have you got?

Close up on Parnassus's glass plinth..now open-topped and sitting on the edge of the stage... full of the troupe's savings. A sign proclaims "Please Take Generously" Directly behind the glass box is a half-globe with the continent of Africa featured. Sitting on top is Percy playing something ethnic but tasteful on a flute with one hand...his other is held out pathetically... a beggar. He blacked up and dressed in rags. He doesn't look happy. He sneaks nervous glances at the glass box of money. The wagon, newly painted in sleek and stylish black and white, stands in Bond Street or some similarly fashionabl street with expensive shops and art galleries. RICH WOMEN anxious to be conspicuous in their consumption of wealth glide past. New signs proclaim `The Choice Is Yours' `The Imaginarium More Exclusive than ever'. The stage, hung with soft,flowing, gauzy fabric, has been chromatically divided in half - one side black, the other white. On the dark side a bloated, sun-glassed woman consuming v quantities of food reclines on an elaborate lounge. She i in fact, a very uncomfortable ANTON in full and fulsome d

Center stage stands DR. PARNASSUS dressed as a stylized doctor with head reflector. In his hand is a staff with a elaborate sun on the top. He is blindfolded. On the white side of the stage stands the mirror and a stylized Tree of Knowledge with bright red apples. Under tree, and reflected in the mirror, sits VALENTINA as Eve...naked except for a long wig that maintains her mode She gracefully combs her hair. Above the mirror is a sign proclaiming "The Naked Truth". DR. PARNASSUS, peeking under his blindfold, is distinctly uncomfortable by his daughter's lack of attire. TONY, in a beautifully cut white suit, and wearing his `romantic' Venetian carnival mask sits in profile in a dr pose on the edge of the white side of the stage. Nobody speaks. They pay no attention to the crowd. A few women stop, curious. One of them takes out some mon and puts it in the glass plinth and turns to go.
(retrieving the money) Excuse me, madam. I'm afraid we can't accept this.
The woman stops, confused. Tony hands her back her money.

We are here to give...not take. We are here to help those in need. If it's money you need, then here it is. (referring to the glass plinth) If it's the flowering of the soul you need, then here we are but, unfortunately we are booked solid at the moment. But thank you.. I can see you have a generous spirit.
TONY returns to his pensive pose.    The women look at ea other.
Excuse me but, how does this work? What does it cost?
Cost? Money is no good in the Imaginarium.   This is a refuge for hearts in need of truth. A place for souls to be purified.
How long does that take?   I'm running late.
Madam, why should you care about time? What are your dreams worth in minutes? The women grow pensive.
There are hard choices to be made in life. (he indicates the tableaux)

What about the dreams of the less fortunate in the world. Do you have time for their dreams? Or are you like I once was...do you just despair? Despair at all that is wrong in the world.. (getting to his feet)

...despair at your inability to do anything to change it.. to make it better...I despaired so much at the powerlessness of my own existence that I took the easy way out...the coward's way...I committed suicide! Yes, that's right, I killed myself. Can you understand my despair? But I was saved...saved by a miracle...The Imaginarium...and Doctor Parnassus. He brought me back from the dead. He gave me a new life. A reason to live. He has given me power to dream again... to dream of a better world. During his speech, more and more people have gathered. So are actually weeping. They are press forward putting mone in the plinth. Tony tries to stop them but, they insist. VALENTINA, ANTON, PERCY, and DR. PARNASSUS are astonished TONY'S performance.
Stop pushing!/Excuse me, can one make a booking?/Are you taking bookings?/Stop pushing at the back!/Form a queue!
Please, I'm sorry but, we're booked solid at the moment. A Louis Vuitton-dressed woman (60+ years old)at the back the crowd shouts:
Is that child up for adoption? She points at the blacked up PERCY.
I want to adopt that unfortunate black child. It shouldn't be working like this. It should be in school. PERCY is appalled.
Who's in charge here? The LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN looks around as a couple of POLIC OFFICERS arrive on the scene. TONY spots them too and heads off the LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN she makes towards them.
Madam, congratulations, you have been chosen. The other WOMEN gasp.
What?
Come forward and enter the Imaginarium.
But, I haven't paid.
We don't want your money. We want your hopes and dreams. You may make a donation later, if you wish.
But...

This is a rare moment. Very few are chosen. Don't miss this once-in-a- life-time opportunity. This way. Please. He ushers the uneasy LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN onto the stage a guides her upstage. PARNASSUS goes into his trance.

Believe me Madam, you're the luckiest woman in the world. The LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN steps into the mirror. TONY hesitates..a moment of uncertainty. VALENTINA encourages with a smile. He steps through. Across the street a clock begins striking the hour. CUT TO the two POLICE OFFICERS who start to move the crow and show on.
Alright, I think it's time to move on, folks. But on spotting the naked VALENTINA who winks at them, th agree between themselves to give the show a bit longer.

TONY and THE LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN are astonished to find themselves in the romantic, soft-focus, pastel-colour set of a soothing, sophisticated, shampoo commercial. Soft fabrics waft, cleansing waterfalls cascade, rose-pet float through the air, beautiful girls swing from swings attached to clouds - all in delicious slow motion.
(overcome)
Oh... how gorgeous...

THE LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN takes TONY'S hand and looks at hi meaningfully. TONY, disorientated, takes a moment to regain his composu He smiles and, with an effort, puts his arm around THE LO VUITTON WOMAN'S wide waist. He looks into her eyes. She's love.
(moans softly) Ohhh... What bliss... and I don't even know your name...
Tony...
Tony. How dashing.

A bar or two of tango encourages them to take a couple of intimate tango dance steps. Now gently wafting curtains part to reveal.. down a flowe strewn path and over a bridge... a sleazy motel with a shingle over the door reads: "The One Night Stand Motel". the office window sits MR. NICK
Oh, goodness me!
She bats her eyelashes at TONY and begins, knowingly, to him towards the motel.
(resisting) If I'm not wrong, I fear you must go alone.
THE LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN pouts playfully, pulling him onwa
Why would I want to go without you darling?
It's one of the rules... One imagination at a time, free from the influence of another.
(petulant) Boring.
They have reached the bridge. Stairs descend to a stream.

Oh..look... another possibility.. Below them a gondola rests in the stream as small, flower bedecked barques float past with framed pictures of roman heroes who died young; Keats, Shelly, Byron, James Dean, Rudolph Valentino, Marilyn Monroe, Buddy Holly, Princess Diana... the stream continues off into the distance to a dark, towering Egyptian pyramid. TONY is as bemused as THE LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN.
You must make a choice...and... actually, to be honest, I'd strongly recommend this one.
But... Rudolph Valentino, James Dean, Princess Di?... all these people... they're dead.
(thinking fast)

Exactly. To be reborn, first you must die. All of them have achieved a kind of immortality. And we love them all the more for it. They won't get old or fat. They won't get sick or feeble. They are beyond fear. They are forever young. They are gods. And you can join them.
(softening)
You're such a wonderful speaker. The gondola awaits....with a beautiful male model at the helm. THE LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN smiles at him.

There's not a moment to lose. But as she hesitates a dark shadow rises over them. TONY, looking past the WOMAN"S shoulder, sees the dark waters o the stream rise up transforming into a GIGANTIC KING COBR that towers menacingly over them. It's wearing a BOWLER HAT... and it's angry.

But your sacrifice must be pure. You have to let go of all these worldly goods. He helps THE LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN remove her necklace, earrings, bracelets, rings, broach, in double quick time guides her onto the gondola, blowing a kiss after her.

Remember nothing is permanent... not even death. He turns back to see the GIGANTIC KING COBRA shrinking ba below the bridge, transforming itself back into the water the stream. From under the arch of the bridge hangs a rop At its end.. a hangman's noose. TONY stares at it darkly disconcerted.
TONY re-enters the stage through the mirror, looking at D PARNASSUS who has just come out of his trance with astonishment
(gobsmacked)
That was so... I had no idea... It's just... incredible. ...And then he realizes the clock is still striking the h realizing that only a few moments have passed since he entered the mirror.
..how do you do this?
(ignoring him and with a big theatrical gesture)

Hooplah! The LOUIS VUITTON woman reappears, sitting on a cut-out c descending from the ceiling of the stage. She looks radia She is weeping, completely overcome by her experience. PARNASSUS steps forward and helps her to her feet. She ki his hands in gratitude.
Thank you, thank you, that was so beautiful, I feel so... thank you so much...
(graciously) Thank YOU, dear Lady, you give me strength to continue

Born again, tearful but transcendent, the LOUIS VUITTON W produces her cheque book and begins to write a cheque. TONY is frozen, confused. The crowd is still... stunned b the LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN's transformation as she deposits cheque, her handbag, her expensive coat in the glass box glides benignly through the crowd... which parts in awe. Pause... and then the other WOMEN rush the stage. Mayhem narrowly averted as TONY and PERCY manage to coral them i a more-or-less orderly queue. Across the street, standing in the doorway of a shop sell luxury goods, is MR NICK. He watches events, intrigued... ...as TONY escorts a second woman through the mirror, and third, they descend, ecstatic, emptying the contents of t handbags, their pearls, earrings and diamond rings into t glass box. TONY pays off the cops who move on. TONY, getting more and more flamboyant, forgets to lower mask each time he re-enters the stage. And now a fourth w descends. Four successes for DOCTOR PARNASSUS.
(aside to Percy) One more to go and we're free.

DOCTOR PARNASSUS spots MR NICK across the street, smiles, holds up four fingers. MR NICK gives a little `I'm not impressed' smirk and turn away and pretends to be interested in the luxury goods in shop window as four large dark heavy RUSSIAN MEN, all lad with luxury shopping walk past. One of the RUSSIANS stops..looking at the show..at TONY w mask is sitting on top of his head. The leading RUSSIAN pulls him on.
C'mon..What are you watching that crap for.
(pointing at TONY)
It's him!
Who are you talking about? (following SERGE's pointed finger)
Impossible.

I'm sure. They start pushing through the crowd. TONY, reaching down to help an elderly lady up to the sta looks up and sees the RUSSIANS heading through the crowd. Panic!! He pulls the mask down and begins to back up. But it's too late, they've definitely seen him. He spins around and rockets upstage, past DR. PARNASSUS w is deep into his trance. TONY dives through the mirror much to the amazement of VALENTINA, ANTON, PERCY. The RUSSIANS chase after him, shoving the queuing WOMEN aside, smashing the scenery and knocking ANTON into the wings.
The RUSSIANS charge through the shampoo-commercial landsc No TONY.. Just slo-mo fashion models and soft wafting fab and aromatic breezes.
Where did he go?
You tell me... It can't be him. He's dead. We killed him.
So why did he run?
There he is!!

In the distance, TONY is hiding behind some billowing fab On being spotted, he takes off up a hill. The RUSSIANS race toward the hill only to crash into a so wall - painted as a landscape with TONY frozen in mid str Looking off to their right they see Tony heading up anoth hill. But as they rush in that direction another wall ris up blocking them. Again it is painted with a hill and TON frozen in midstride. A third and fourth wall rise up.. surrounding and trapping the RUSSIANS. There is a cell door in one wall. Like crazy animals they start throwing themselves against the door trying to brea down. It won't budge. While the others batter the door, GREGOR, who has been somewhat affected by the soft shampoo commercial world, s quietly in a corner picking pretty flowers. Exhausted, the other RUSSIANS collapse on the ground. GREGOR gently breathes in the aroma of the flowers and exhales. As he does the door swings open. The other RUSSI gape at him... then barrel out the door. Outside is a new, beautiful, landscape - the sky dotted w white fluffy clouds. Extending from the ground to each cl is an incredibly long ladder. On each ladder is a person climbing upwards. The RUSSIANS spot Tony. He is already a hundred feet up a ladder and climbing. Unfortunately, their way is blocked by an over-bright, hy active, wide-eyed sales girl.
Hi! Hello! Today's special! Reach for the clouds! Discover your true potential! Gift certificates are available at...
The RUSSIANS roughly shove her aside.     As they rush pa GREGOR pauses, hands her his flowers.
Relax...smell the flowers.

Reaching the base of TONY'S ladder, the RUSSIANS start climbing. Seeing the threat, TONY kicks hard and breaks the rungs b him.. setting off a domino effect with more rungs breakin downward towards the RUSSIANS. Snap! Crack! Rungs break i their grasp.. they fall. The RUSSIANS land in a tangled heap as the domino effect continues down to the base of the ladder. Laughing down at them, TONY turns to continue climbing - to see the domino effect heading down from the top of the ladder... towards him. THE LADDER COMPLETELY SEPARATES IN TWO. Tony struggles to maintain his balance - and somehow mana to get his feet on the two halves of a broken rung. Then, if he were on giant stilts, starts to stride away. The RUSSIANS chase after him but, his giant strides leave them far behind. Smugly, TONY looks back just as one of t legs of his ladder snags on a fallen log. He loses his balance... and plunges hundreds of feet earthward. From nowhere, ANTON (still dressed as a fat woman) appear running to catch the plummeting TONY. He does and Whomp!! is flattened. Knocked out cold. TONY is unscathed.. his f broken by ANTON'S padding. But, the RUSSIANS arrive, grab TONY, start to beat him up
You thieving scumbag! We break every bone in your body! They scrawl strange symbols on TONY'S forehead.
No! Wait! I can explain! Give me a chance!
We want our money or you die again! This time for good! ANTON struggles to his feet.
Stop it! L-leave him alone!
The RUSSIANS turn and, thinking ANTON is a fat, bossy, mi aged woman, hesitate.

Stand b-back! I'm warning you! Foolishly, he whips off his wig and assumes a manly marti arts pose. The RUSSIANS look at each other. Then, utterly ignoring ANTON, turn their attention back to beating TONY GREGOR walks calmly over to ANTON who is in attack mode.
(bending down and picking a flower, he offers it to ANTON)

Relax. Smell the flowers. Confused, ANTON takes the flower, sniffs and then... GREG floors him with a powerful punch on the nose Meanwhile, the RUSSIANS have a noose around TONY's neck a have looped the rope over a tree branch. TONY struggles t pull out the metal pipe he keeps on a string around his n He gets it to his mouth as if to swallow it when... ... the ground erupts and a giant London policeman's helm rises up (we are talking 20 feet tall)and revolves - revealing DR. PARNASSUS' carved and painted face beneath. The mouth drops open and a great red tongue rolls out lik welcoming red carpet. From inside the giant mouth a smili policeman beckons the RUSSIANS to come on in.. The terrified RUSSIANS let go of the lynching rope. TONY drops to the ground and, with a whistle, the brass p flies out of his mouth. Behind the RUSSIANS a painted backdrop unfurls..it reads "JOIN THE FUZZ.. WE LOVE VIOLENCE".. and a chorus line of LONG-LEGGED GIRLS in mini-skirted police outfits appear - high-kicking a snappy song and dance number. The astonished RUSSIANS don't know what the fuck is going Suddenly, a friendly OLD WOMAN'S VOICE is heard shouting something in Russian. Spinning around, the RUSSIANS see an old BABOUSHKA (Russi grandmother) outside a tumble-down cottage waving gaily t them. A stunned pause. Then, pell-mell, they rush to her.

Mama!   Mama! Help! Save us! As they run toward her they get smaller and smaller. She lifts her skirts and all four disappear underneath. And then.. BOOM!.. a muffled explosion balloons the skirts outward. Smoke spews out from below. Straightening her skirt, the BABOUSHKA looks up, and pull off her head - revealing MR.NICK's tiny head poking out o the collar. He smiles smugly. The giant POLICEMAN DR. PARNASSUS registers disappointmen and, like a balloon rapidly deflating, spins off into the sending up a cloud of dust obscuring everything. The dust clears and TONY and ANTON find themselves in a desolate, empty landscape. Nowhere. Nothing.
Did you see me!! I almost reached the clouds! I could have...it was incredible...I was almost there...
Shut up! Over a distant rise the wagon appears, pulled by the hors ANTON drags Tony, babbling and stumbling, towards it.
I made my choice and I climbed... I felt so much potential. I could have done anything. I have to have another chance...another go...I need this...
The wagon is parked on waste ground. It looms out of nowh illuminated by a light leaking from within. We hear PERCY'S angry voice.
Maybe you were holding them upside down.
What?
That cards! The bloody Tarot cards!
(distraught and angry) Enough, Percy! Enough!
I made a mistake. A big mistake. I know that and I'm sorry.
The angry troupe huddles amongst the clutter of props and jumbled scenery. TONY is on trial. DR. PARNASSUS is sitting in a corner, head in hands. He s utterly destroyed.
You're a l-liar. You've been lying to us all along. Who are you? Who were those thugs?
I am not a liar!
No?
No! I just... didn't divulge everything I knew.
Comes to the same thing.
Absolutely not. Not in law.
You stole their money.
No. I didn't.
That's what they said.
Are you going to believe them before you believe me?
Why not?

Because they're irredeemably bad people, and I'm essentially good. I know that sounds terribly prim and arrogant and self righteous, but I'm trying to be honest. Look, the truth is... in order to get my charity off the ground I needed capital.
ANTON looks askance.

(in response to Anton) Yes, I know, and you're right, but that's the way the grown-up..the real world works. You can't make omelettes without soiling your hands. Or should that be the other way round? Anyway, I - with hindsight very foolishly - accepted a loan from people who seemed to me, at the time, to be very decent and sincere. There was absolutely no way I could have known that they were part of a ruthless organised crime syndicate and that they wanted to use my charity to launder money. I made a mistake. And I have to live with that. I'm sorry. What more can I say?
VALENTINA wants to believe TONY. ANTON and PERCY don't.
(distressed but basically sympathetic) Oh Tony.
But, can we not talk about me for a moment.. I want to thank the Doctor for letting me experience the most sublime, inspiring ....
So why were they trying to k-kill you? "Again!" is what they said.
What?
(answering his own question)
The first time they hung you from the b-bridge... right?... B-because you stole their money.

Stop saying that! I didn't steal it! I didn't have it. I'd had to invest in infrastructure. I needed more time. When you run a charity you have to give lots of money away. You wouldn't believe the red tape. The Charity Commission are a bunch of fascists. It's incredible. I mean... c'mon give me a break...I almost died today.. and I said I'm sorry... and anyway..... this was supposed to be a special day...it's Valentina's birthday. He pulls out the LOUIS VUITTON WOMAN'S beautiful necklace from his pocket.
Happy birthday. For a beautiful woman. He puts it around Valentina's neck. VALENTINA smiles.   A glowers.
The marks on your face...
Marks?
They scrawled something on your forehead. Symbols... Signs... TONY looks uncomfortable, tries to rub his forehead clean
You had some of those when we rescued you.

Yes, what's that about? But, before he can say anything, there's a knock on the d which startles everyone. They exchange looks. DR. PARNASSUS is frightened but hides this from the other The knock is repeated. PERCY starts to get up.
(sotto voce)
No! Leave it! PERCY sits down. The knock comes again.
(sotto voce to the DR. PARNASSUS)
Who is it?
(sotto voce)
It's too late... for visitors. Once more someone knocks. Everyone is edgy. Particularly PERCY. The knock comes again.
(sotto voce, agitated)

Please can we answer the door? I can't stand not answering the door, or the telephone, or whatever. It's not in my nature. I won't sleep for weeks if we don't answer the door! Sorry! DR. PARNASSUS gets up, goes to the door, opens it and ste outside, closing the door behind him. VALENTINA, ANTON, PERCY and TONY exchange looks.
(embarrassed)
Sorry, I just... I've got a thing about...

head_text.subj: EXT OUTSIDE THE WAGON THAT MOMENT

text: DR. PARNASSUS and MR NICK move away from the door and go around to the front. The stage is half-opened. The horses are standing steaming nearby.
(very down)
I know... It's over....you've won...
Four rotten Russkies?
And the girl..from the pub. MR NICK shakes his head.
Sally doesn't count.    Do you, gal? SALLY (the woman thrown out from the wagon as they escape from the pub mob) steps out of the shadows, puts her arms around NICK
You're joking... toying with me. Like a cat with a mouse... As is your privilege.

Sal didn't get to make a real choice. You were gaga. Out for the count. Wouldn't be fair...And you've got four, thanks to your friend Tony. So... we're even... it's not quite over. He smiles, lights a cigarette, takes a deep drag...
Not quite. (checks his watch)
Oh,oh, look at the time...it's 11.
...and he wanders off into the darkness with SALLY. Somewhere, a clock strikes 11. DR. PARNASSUS, agitated, watches him go.
Father?
DR. PARNASSUS looks round to find VALENTINA standing next him. He starts to round up the horses.
Valentina... my darling girl. We must do another show! Now! Quickly! Get ready to move out!
Who was that?
Somebody asking the way. Where's Tony?
I overheard you... He wasn't asking the way.
Please! Get everybody together. Another show! Tony! Percy!
I want to know what's going on.
(harnessing the horses) Not now.
Yes, now! I want to know the truth!
The truth?
What are you hiding?
There are more important things, at this moment!
It's something to do with that bloody rambling story you were telling me the night we found Tony isn't it? PARNASSUS sighs. Stops. He checks his watch
Yes.
So tell me.
What I told you was... the truth. I really am thousands of years old. I have been immortal. I have been mortal. And I have had many dealings with the devil. Too many.
(fearful)
What are you saying?...

Remember the woman I was telling you about?.. the one I was so desperately in love with.. so in love that I made a deal with the devil? That was your mother... ...she was so beautiful, so enchanting...so... Looking at VALENTINA, DR. PARNASSUS sees her morph into t BEAUTIFUL WOMAN appearing. He almost swoons.

... so young. She was everything I had ever dreamed of. I made a choice. I bargained away my immortality. I regained my youth... and I won her. I did! I won her...! The BEAUTIFUL WOMAN morphs back into VALENTINA.
...but at a price... DR. PARNASSUS looks haggard. He closes his eyes. He sways loses his balance.
VALENTINA stops him from falling.
What price?
(anguished)
It's too terrible...
Tell me...
I... The price of my obsession... (he groans)
I can't say it.
Say it.
You.
What?
I was mortal again... on condition that... any children I fathered... would, on their sixteenth birthday... belong to him.
(stunned)
Him?... VALENTINA can't take it in.
But... didn't...
Your mother never knew. She died before I had to tell her.
I don't believe this! It can't be true. It's just another of your wretched stories... A cruel story!
If only...
Why do you say these things?
It's true. Every word. But all is not lost. VALENTINA looks at him.
(feverishly)
A new wager... The first of five. If I win... you're free... you're mine again.. and we can win! Where's Tony? We can still win!
By playing games with the devil!?
With one more show. The day isn't over.
No!
Valentina.

All my life you've made me play `Beauty', `Truth', `Justice'... filled my head with dreams and high ideals. All that crap! While... all the time...! The devil was right! You're arrogant! Vain and arrogant! I'm just another one of your stupid wagers!... You're beneath contempt. She rushes off into the dark night.
Valentina! That's not true! It's not like that! Wait! Come back! Valentina! A dark silhouette stands in the shadow of the wagon. It's TONY. What has he heard?
DR. PARNASSUS rushes into the wagon. PERCY is already on his feet, having heard the DOCTOR shouting.
What's happened?
Valentina... She's... she's gone... ANTON rushes out. PERCY stops by DR. PARNASSUS before he exits.
Telling the truth... Always a bad idea.
ANTON, running, calling for VALENTINA. PERCY is scouring the area on horseback. ANTON running though a newspaper-filled tip, sees a headl on one of the newspapers. Stops.

head_text.subj: EXT THE WAGON A LITTLE LATER

text: PARNASSUS, a bottle in his hand, is lurching around.

You fool! You monstrous fool!    You should be dead. He starts to violently bang his head against the side of wagon. Suddenly the stage begins to unfold. PARNASSUS looks up, unable to see what or who is doing this. He drunkenly stumbles around the side to see TONY pulling ropes.
What are you doing?
Saving Valentina.
(befuddled) What?... How?
I overheard you. You only need one more to win. Me! I'll be that one. I'll take the risk to save Valentina and, hopefully, you sir. We've still got a few minutes.
Tony steers DOCTOR PARNASSUS towards his glass column.
Yes! Yes! Of course! Of course! Thank God! Thank God!
(to himself) How about thanking me?
What?
I expect nothing in return.
(trying to go into a trance) No. You're a saint... A saint.
Only Valentina's hand in marriage, if she'll have me...
(not listening) Oh, my head...
And, as your son-in-law... perhaps... initiation into the secrets of the trance.
No! I can't do it!
But... (realizing Parnassus is referring to his inability to go into a trance)
Why not?! What's wrong?
My mind... I can't concentrate... I'm too upset...
You must do it! You have to do it! It's the only way to save your daughter!
(distraught)
I know...
(sitting PARNASSUS down)
Concentrate. You must concentrate. (clearing the way to the mirror)
I'll make the right choice. I'm sure of it. I can feel how right it is already. TONY leaps back to steady DR. PARNASSUS who looked as tho he were about to topple off his pillar.

Oh God!... Doctor... We can save her.. you and me. I need this. We both need this. Please. The trance. PARNASSUS quiets down.   Starts mumbling. TONY rushes to the mirror. Steps through. He finds himsel standing amongst the stage scenery. Nothing else.
Bugger! He steps back out of the mirror.    Goes to PARNASSUS who weeping.
It's no good!
TONY shakes him hard.
PULL YOURSELF TOGETHER!... Sir. Concentrate...or you'll have lost her forever. PARNASSUS slowly goes into a sobbing kind of trance state TONY confirms he is in a trance, then rushes to the mirro
Tony...oh, Tony.. What?! TONY stops. Looks around. There in the shadows huddles VALENTINA, sobbing.
(sobbing)

It's useless... Hopeless... I thought I was strong, but I don't even know how to run away... TONY hesitates.. No time! He looks back to PARNASSUS who seems to still be in his trance. Hesitates. Then rushes t VALENTINA.
It's alright... it's alright... Don't cry. It's going to be alright, believe me.
This stupid theatre...!... That's all I've ever known...! I've always believed it was something precious, but it's not... it's a lie...I hate it! TONY lifts her up, putting his arm around her.
Everything's going to be alright... I'll take you away. I'll show you the world. My world. The great big beautiful world I've always dreamed of... You'll love it. VALENTINA, grateful, clings to TONY.
Yes?
Maybe.
C'mon then. They turn to the mirror but, an off-stage clearing of the throat makes them look round to see ANTON watching them. holding a torn and dirty piece of newspaper.
Ah, there you are, Tony. Here's something m-might interest you. (reading)
'Missing: D-disgraced head of children's charity'.
No! TONY tries to snatch the paper but ANTON steps back.
N-not a bad p-picture, Tony. Listen to this Valentina... it's about Tony's b-beautiful world..
Valentina!     Where are you? PARNASSUS is still in his trance but, mumbling.
...Anthony Shepherd, who was arrested last week on charges of... VALENTINA is surrounded. Confused.
(to Valentina)

Valentina, Don't listen to that. I'm innocent. This is the work of people who are trying to destroy me! Evil people! Believe me! Look, I'll show you the truth! TONY pulls VALENTINA towards the mirror.
ANTON tries to stop him, but TONY pushes him back, off th stage. He crashes to the ground.
(grabbing VALENTINA)
Hurry! TONY and VALENTINA disappear through the mirror.
(sobbing in his trance)
Valentina! Forgive me.
Mist and rain descend as TONY and VALENTINA run through t darkened shapes of the shampoo-commercial landscape - now tattered, ragged, and wind blown. Darkness reigns.
This isn't right. This is all wrong. Which way? Soaked and cold they spy a welcome sight. A uniformed val with an open umbrella stands by the door of a sleek limo.
Your car is here, Mr.Tony.
Ah, Lester, just in time. TONY ducks under the umbrella and helps VALENTINA into th car ahead of himself. As she slides across the seat she notices the driver - bo hatted and smoking a cigarette.

No! Tony, don't get in! Get away! She pushes TONY back and scrambles out...dragging him bac out into the dark rain. The driver turns around.   It's MR.NICK.. looking vexed. VALENTINA and TONY struggle through the rain. Suddenly, t find themselves in deep water up to their chests. They ar sinking. Through the mist they see a boat. It is the gond that transported the LOUIS VUITTON LADY.
Help! Over here!
The boatman turns the boat in their direction. TONY tries pull himself on board. The boatman reaches down to help.
Give me your hand
It's MR. NICK.    VALENTINA recoils, drags TONY off the b
Stop! What are you doing!   We'll drown!
No we won't. This is the way.

She points to jumbled rocks just visible in the darkness. They drag themselves onto them. The rocky monoliths appea to be the same as the landscape ANTON climbed over when h was searching for DIEGO, the son of THE FAMILY FROM HELL. And, like a repeat of that experience, from behind the ri rises the Parnassus-faced Mongolfier balloon. But, now th eyes stream tears and rain pours down. In the basket is ANTON.
Don't d-do it. Don't g-go on. Not with him! He's all lies.
Just like my father. Leave me alone. I don't care anymore. I want a new life.
Valentina...

He pulls her away..towards a little tumble-down cottage. candlelight glows in the windows, smoke curls from the chimney. They run to the door. TONY bangs on it. Someone can be heard unlatching the locks inside. A child's crying cuts through the wind. VALENTINA turns and sees a little girl sitting on the pat among flapping laundry. She rushes to her, tries to pick up but, the little girl resists..
Tony, help me, she's heavy. The door has just opened and TONY is halfway through. turns, irritated.

What is it now?! Can't we just go inside and get dry. Behind him, in the warmth, stands the old BABOUSHKA. Seeing that VALENTINA is really struggling with the littl girl, TONY reluctantly goes to help. The little girl, on seeing TONY, tries to break away but, he holds on to her.
(shouting angrily)

Ostanobuite bas menshi schit! The litle girl goes quiet. VALENTINA looks at TONY with surprise. The BABOUSHKA looks angry. Suddenly a light beg to suffuse TONY and the little girl. A small orchestra ca be heard playing garden party music.

You did it! You made the right choice! The light fills the screen and we find... ...TONY, sleekly groomed and immaculately dressed, holdin the smiling little girl. She too has been cleaned and buffed. The sun shines. He stands in...

...a large well kept lawn covered with smart guests, BUSI PEOPLE, POLITICIANS, POP STARS, CELEBS... Behind and beyond them is an impressive country house. A small orchestra is playing. There is a marquee. WAITERS and WAITRESSES move amongst the assembled notable bearing trays of drinks and food. TONY is the focus of attention. A TV current-affairs/news JOURNALIST with CAMERA CREW is following him around.
Sustainability's great, if you can achieve it. The problem is, in many cases you simply can't, for a whole variety of reasons.
TONY smiles and shakes the hand of someone in a wheelchai A GROUP OF GUESTS burst into spontaneous applause. Everyb loves and admires TONY. He smiles boyishly. He moves on. The TV CREW stay with him.
Aren't you running the risk of entrenching the need for charity by increasingly institutionalising it?
Look, charity, like poor little Olga... (referring to the little girl) ...is always with us, to coin a phrase...
VALENTINA appears. She is beautifully dressed, coiffed, m up, she looks stunning.
(to VALENTINA) Ah, there you are, my lovely.
She and TONY exchange broad smiles. They're in love. He p her to his side and puts his arm around her. The photographers snap away.
And what's your message to the Prime Minister?
(laughs engagingly) I wouldn't presume to have a 'message' for the Prime Minister... Fortunately for the Foundation, I think we pretty much see eye to eye on most things.
Now we hear a distant buzzing. EVERYBODY looks up.
They see a speck in the sky, it's the PRIME MINISTER'S approaching helicopter... TONY and the posse of JOURNALISTS and PHOTOGRAPHERS rush leaving VALENTINA standing alone.
The PRIME MINISTER and his WIFE get out of the helicopter followed by their AIDES. TONY and the PRIME MINISTER shak hands for THE TV CAMERAS. VALENTINA watches from a distance..ignored.

A huge chandelier illuminates a grand ornate ballroom whe wealthy guests, in evening dress, are being seated at tab by liveried ushers. Large beautiful photographs of the underprivileged children of the world line the walls. A great banner reads "Suffer The Little Children Benefit Ba The PRIME MINISTER and his WIFE are seated at the head ta facing the dais, bubbly and expectant. Security is heavy.

TONY is conferring with his speech writers and assistants VALENTINA descends the staircase looking utterly stunning a beautiful gown. TONY bows, romantically kissing her han He turns her to admire their reflections in a gilt mirror...the perfect, beautiful, dream couple.

You look gorgeous, my love.   I knew you wouldn't let me down. The little girl, OLGA, and a little boy are brought forwa They are dressed in ethnic clothes. TONY takes OLGA'S hand...offers the little boy's hand to VALENTINA. She tak it in her own. The four of them start to walk to the door leading to the ballroom.
(looking to everyone)
This is a vitally important moment for the future of the Foundation. The children of the world are depending on us.
Valentina!
Anton!?
TONY and VALENTINA look around. ANTON is nowhere to be se but, his voice continues.
All of this is false! It's nothing to do with you! It's all him. It's his imagination!
Call security, somebody.
It's all rotten! A naked lie! You've got to understand!
The LITTLE BOY is tugging VALENTINA'S arm.       She look It's ANTON. A child-size ANTON.
Look at this...
He produces the newspaper with TONY'S photo and news stor
...`Tony Liar'..
What?   How?...
TONY lunges for him but, ANTON dodges out of the way.
(reading and dodging) 'The disgraced director of the children's charity "Suffer the Little Children, who was arrested last..
Security guards have rushed in.
Stop him. Silence the little bastard!
(dodging the guards)
...who was arrested last week on charges of involvement in the sale of organs from third world children to wealthy Westerners'...unghh! TONY has grabbed little ANTON and starts hitting him.
And now he doesn't stutter! You see!? It was all an act to get cheap sympathy!
(pulling TONY off ANTON)
Take your hands off him!! Stop it!
Get off me! What are you doing? (lashing out and hitting VALENTINA in the face)

You've betrayed me! Haven't you? You let him in...into my world, you bitch!?.. after all I've lavished on you...OW!! Little ANTON has leapt on TONY's back and sunk his teeth TONY'S ear. TONY throws him off and starts beating him.
In the glittering ballroom a children's choir sings.

"We are the world..we are the children..." Behind the choir the double doors of the ballroom crash open... exposing TONY violently beating up an `ethnic chi Stunned silence as the horror of this happy scene sinks i Then...
My God! Somebody stop him!   He's a monster! Get him! As one they leap to their feet.

TONY looks up and freezes. At the same time the walls of ballroom begin to crack and disintegrate. TONY'S world st to fall apart... literally. The floor around TONY falls away into an abyss leaving on narrow escape route. He hurls ANTON aside and dashes away the GUESTS pursue him. ANTON avoids being trampled but, loses his footing and falls over the edge.
Anton!!!
VALENTINA, fighting through the angry GUESTS, rushes to t edge of the abyss. ANTON is struggling to hold on to a broken floor joist that protrudes several feet down from side of the cliff face.
Valentina!..help me. Please.
His grip slips. VALENTINA reaches for him, grasps his han
Forgive me, Anton. I was wrong.
I know... I'm not a child.
And.. ANTON REVERTS TO HIS NORMAL SIZE...AND WEIGHT.
I love you, Valentina.
ANTON slips out of her grip, plummeting into the abyss.
Noooo!
Suddenly, VALENTINA is jerked backwards by her hair.
Who's behind this!? Eh!? You didn't come up with this all on your own did you!!!??? (slapping her) No! Someone's got at you. Someone's paid you!!!... Who!!!??? Tell me!!!
Valentina! My darling daughter! There you are!

They turn to see PARNASSUS in the distance (where once th ballroom stood) stumbling towards them, drunk, desperate. he moves forward a new landscape is created behind him. TONY rushes towards PARNASSUS.
You old bastard! This is all your doing!
(drunkenly)
All my doing?... I'm merely the facilititatater, dear boy.
There he is! Stop him! Leave her alone. Get him! Throwing his arm around TONY, PARNASSUS spins him around face the MOB rushing towards him.

I create the opportunities. Is it my fault if your not up to it? Tony wrenches his arm free and violently shoves the drunk DOCTOR right into the path of the frenzied MOB. PARNASSUS trampled underfoot in their rush to catch TONY.
Father! No! PARNASSUS'S body lies broken on the ground. Frantically, VALENTINA rushes to him, throwing herself on her father's battered body, sobbing hysterically.

NO..NO NO... Please.. father..it's all my fault. What have I done?... With siren wailing, an AMBULANCE arrives, screeching to a halt. PARAMEDICS pull VALENTINA away. They check PARNASSU for signs of life and begin to lift him onto the gurney. VALENTINA can't control herself and tries to throw hersel onto his body. The PARAMEDICS struggle with her.
(with a severe stutter)
P-p-p-lease m-mis-s, there's-s n-n-othing y-y-y-you c-can d-d-o, he-he-he's d-d-dead...
VALENTINA wrenches herself out of their grasp howling lik animal and rushes away out of earshot before the PARAMEDI can finish speaking.

...d-dead drunk. A bottle falls from the DOCTOR'S hand and explodes in a million fragments as it hits the ground. The shimmering fragments coalesce into a fractured mirror corridor down which a multi-reflected VALENTINA runs - sobbing like a madwoman - lashing out at her reflections, some of which are flashbacks of her flirting with TONY, irritated with ANTON, angry with PARNASSUS.
(to her reflections)

You little fool! You're to blame!.. for everything... I hate you! The multi-reflection broken mirror corridor ends at two mirrors identical to the one used in the Imaginarium. The to the left is marked 'His' with a bowler hat, the other the right 'Hers' with a bonnet. She hesitates.
(laughing madly)

So this is to be my choice!! MR NICK appears out of the "His" mirror - a burst of flam behind him. He makes a sweeping gesture inviting VALENTINA to enter t mirror marked 'Hers'. VALENTINA, heads for the mirror marked 'His'. MR NICK blo her path.
Now, there's absolutely no need for that. That's just plain contrariness. VALENTINA tries to get around him.
You think you deserve punishment but you're a kid - you have no idea...trust me. VALENTINA feints another direction. MR NICK blocks her.
(a crazed look)
Wrong. I'm 16...I'm a woman now.. She spins around him...he blocks....a kind of dance betwe them begins - confusingly reflected in the mirrors. A tan can be heard.
...a selfish bitch, everyone I love dies...I'm...
...only fit for hell? If only. He looks at Valentina with lascivious intent. He's tempte briefly, but resists it.

No... your pop would never speak to me again. And that'd be a shame. Let's dance. Reflected in the swirling mirror fragments, they tango un he spins her towards the right hand mirror. She sails thr - and, with a mad smile, throws him a kiss. The mirror closes with a burst of flame. The briefest fla of DR. PARNASSUS face is reflected in the mirror fragment
Valentina!!!!!! MR NICK turns, realizing he has been looking into a mirro fragment reflecting the two mirrors. The writing on the Valentina's mirror reads "His".
Damn!... I've won.

DR. PARNASSUS is sitting alone on a prominent bluff (the one he tried throwing himself off many years ago) He's distraught. Tears run down this cheeks. A distant bell to midnight. MR NICK appears behind PARNASSUS...sits down beside him.
Funny how things work out, isn't it? He lights a cigarette.

It's not what I had in mind y'know... this.. Valentina, being the fifth... It doesn't seem right... She's supposed to be the prize, the star prize... not part of the bloody score... And you lumbered with eternal life all over again... What a bummer, eh? No response from PARNASSUS. A Tarot cards drops from his hand. It is The Hanged Man. MR. NICK points to the plain far below. Across the harsh ground, TONY is running for his life...pursued by the MOB

I hope they get that bastard. Tear him limb from limb... But they won't... He leads a charmed life, that one... I've been trying to nail him for years... I thought I had him this time. But, there's always some prat comes to his rescue... Talk about the luck of the Devil. (he laughs)

Those weird markings you found on him... on his forehead... Those satanic-symbol, so-called, things... What's all that about?... Maybe they protect him in some way... I've never been into that black-magic stuff myself... Can't seem to get the hang of it... I know, pathetic isn't it?...
PARNASSUS ignores him, sunk even deeper into despondency.
