God, I hate to see you like this. Look, I tell you what... If you can get the lowdown on those satanic markings, or.. wait.. better still, if you can wipe that self- righteous little creep off the face of the universe... I'll give you Valentina back.
A beat. Slowly, PARNASSUS looks up.
How about it?

TONY, sweating, panting for breath, is running up the mountain. Below, the MOB is still in hot pursuit. TONY reaches the summit. In front of him, is his salvatio an empty gibbet. A noose hangs from the crossbeam.
Thank God for that!

TONY relaxes a little. We can hear the mob now, struggling up the mountain. TONY digs into one of his pockets and pulls out the brass tube that he has always kept close. TONY opens his mouth and is about to slip the tube down h throat when he spots the Hanged Man Tarot card lying at h feet. A hand from behind him snatches the tube away. TONY, startled, turns to find himself looking up at DR. PARNASSUS. PARNASSUS is standing on a chair with the noose around hi neck. He smiles and opens his hand. The metal tube has vanished. TONY panics. The MOB is getting closer.
With his other hand DR. PARNASSUS produces the tube from TONY'S ear.
(desperate) Give me that!
DR. PARNASSUS gestures at the CROWD.
Give us a moment, please.
The CROWD goes into very slow motion...but twice as angry DR. PARNASSUS teases TONY with magic.
Here's your tube... Here's mine. (producing a second tube) But mine's just a cheap counterfeit... Look, it breaks... (he breaks it) But here's another...
Stop!
You're not amused?

(desperate) You've been talking to the devil, haven't you? Let me guess what he said... If you manage to kill me, he'll release Valentina. Yes? Am I right?... I am aren't I? It's all lies. He can't release her. And why not? Because he doesn't have her. He can't have her because she's the prize. (gaining confidence) He doesn't have five wins. But if you kill me he will, won't he? You'll have lost Valentina forever!
DR. PARNASSUS does a double hand shuffle.
Choose.
This is ridiculous!
Choose! TONY chooses.
You've got to believe me! For all our sakes!
Are you sure you made the right choice?
Look...

Let's find out. He slides the tube down his throat and kicks the chair aw He drops... dangles from the rope...the noose tight aroun his neck. At the same moment, the MOB resumes normal speed and roar the mountain. Is PARNASSUS dead? Working very fast, TONY hoists him over his shoulder and wrestles the noose loose. He drops PARNASSUS on the groun He's stunned but still alive. The MOB is closing in. TONY slaps DR. PARNASSUS hard between the shoulder blades The tube pops out of the DOCTOR'S gullet. TONY catches it
Gotcha! TONY swallows the tube as the MOB surge around the gibbet grabbing him, beating him, and then lifting him onto the chair, tightening the noose around his neck.

Although battered, TONY winks smugly at DR. PARNASSUS, bu his mood changes when he sees DR. PARNASSUS spit out seve more fake tubes, then, gagging, force the real one up and of his gullet. With a look of realization and horror, TONY drops to his death as the MOB kicks the chair away from under him. The MOB cheers. Yes, he's dead. DR. PARNASSUS tosses the metal tube to MR NICK who steps coolly out of the MOB, cigarette in his mouth.
(hoarsely)
There are three cardinal rules. One, there's no black-magic, only cheap tricks. And... er... I forget the others. Now, where's my daughter?
How should I know? You're her father. (with needle)
Her loving father. DR PARNASSUS looks askance at MR NICK.
She's free... isn't she? MR NICK smiles and blows smoke in PARNASSUS'S face. The s fills the screen and becomes...
... a dust storm. The wind is howling. The swirling dust thins to reveal DR.PARNASSUS, alone, exhausted, trudging across a vast desert. He's tormented by his thoughts.
What else could I do, Valentina? What else could I have done... What other choice could I have made?... Damn!... It was the right choice... Of course it was... Of course... But where are you?
Where's my beautiful daughter? Where's my darling? How long must I suffer?

There is no proper road, only endless sand, but neverthel DR. PARNASSUS reaches a signpost which indicates two dist paths. One leads to a tidy little suburban home, the other up an dramatic mountain pass via a painfully steep staircase cu into the rock (the same one that MARTIN THE DRUNK chose n to climb days earlier.
No, no, no... No more choices, please... No more choices...!!!
Enraged, he tries to push the sign over, but is too feebl Exhausted, he subsides onto a smooth protruding stone.
(angry) Hey!

DR. PARNASSUS, alarmed, rolls quickly off the stone. Now on his knees he finds himself looking at the top half PERCY'S head and face. What he'd thought was a stone was, fact, his old companion buried in the sand.
Percy!
DR. PARNASSUS, overjoyed, begins to dig PERCY out.
About bloody time!
Where have you been?
(irritated) Here!
How long have you been here?
How long's a piece of string? Don't ask daft questions.
Thank God I found you. I need your advice. (indicating sign)
I've got a problematical choice to make.

Problematical my arse! Come on... I know it's against the grain... PERCY grabs DR. PARNASSUS'S cloak and begins to pull him across the sand in the direction of the bungalow. We can see the sign reads `Easy'...
(on his dignity)
No! Suburban bungalows and all that they evoke are anathema to me. Dammit Percy! Stop! I've got my pride!
Yeah, it goes just before the fall. PERCY grabs DR. PARNASSUS'S cloak and begins to pull him across the sand in the direction indicated by the sign wh we can now see reads 'Easy'..
Come on... I know it's against the grain...

PERCY pulls the reluctant DR. PARNASSUS up the drive of a suburban bungalow, past a perfect lawn and double garage, the front door. PERCY rings the bell. DR. PARNASSUS tries to make a run for it but PERCY holds fast. The door is opened by VALENTINA. She's older and is carry a BABY in her arms. Both DR. PARNASSUS and VALENTINA are astonished. Neither knows what to say.
Valentina...?
Father...? (recovering) Where have you been?... All these years... I thought you were dead.
So did I. But you... I...
Come in.
VALENTINA steps back and ushers her father in.
(aside) So far, so good.
PERCY is about to follow, but VALENTINA, focussing on her father, closes the door in his face.
VALENTINA shows DR. PARNASSUS into the sitting-room. He s on the sofa.
Mummy? Can I have some ice-cream?
A SMALL BOY enters from the kitchen.
Mummy?
Billy, this is your grandad. Say hello to your grandad. (to Parnassus) I think he looks a little like you.
BILLY takes one look at DR. PARNASSUS and runs back into kitchen. VALENTINA laughs.
He's only five. And he's very shy. Would you like some tea?
DR. PARNASSUS nods.
Okay, you look after Imogen.
She gives him the baby.
She's eight months, and, so far, fortunately, doesn't look in the least like you.
DR. PARNASSUS is moved.
This is all I ever wanted... I know it's not what you wanted for me, but...well... there you go... I'm happy.
ANTON enters.
Hello Doctor.
He puts his arm around VALENTINA.
We're both happy.
DR. PARNASSUS doesn't know what to say. He sits there, a ragged old man with a baby on his knee, tears streaming d his face.
Little cut-out cardboard figures are 'performing' in a to theatre.
It's your choice. You can stay here and look after mum and dad, or come with me and help fight the giant.
I'll have to think about it.
THE CAMERA pulls back to show PERCY manipulating the pupp and giving them voices. He and DR. PARNASSUS are running stall selling toy theatres. Business is good.
The audience is made up of mainly KIDS, with some ADULTS. COMMUTERS come and go. A COUPLE OF PARENTS purchase a theatre for their son. DR. PARNASSUS takes the money and expertly wraps the theatre.
Beautifully made. It'll last for years if properly looked after.
Does it come with a happy ending?
I'm afraid we can't guarantee that.
THE CAMERA angles across the table... In a shadowy corner stands MR NICK, smoking a cigarette.
